title: Rolling Stone Hand-Letter
content:
I posted this a while back, but couldn't manage to find the thread again...   
 ![Goth Lettering -Rolling Stone](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142759im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/27626.jpg)   
   
I was wondering if this typeface fits the bill?   
 [http://www.veer.com/results.asp?image=UMT0000020#about](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142759/http:/www.veer.com/results.asp?image=UMT0000020#about)   
   
I think the original post said that this image was a combination of two fonts...Am I recalling this right?
author: redgumball58

comments.content: Any idea where I can see more of Miles Newlyn's work? I dig the type Ferox...
Thanks..this site never fails to ROCK!!! It always has the answers. Great job everyone...

Miles Newlin's Ferox is now being sold at [Veer](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142759/http:/www.veer.com/results.asp?image=UMT0000020), under their Umbrella Type collection of miscellaneous designers. For convenience, here is a showing of Ferox and the Alternate version in the [Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142759/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script03Pg4.html), Part 3 (Blackletter). Miles generously made these samples for the Guide himself.
